questions.question: Which of the following is a desirable property of a biometric system?
In TCP/IP networking, which protocol is used to hold network addresses and routing information in a packet?
In the context of unexpected negative outcomes in personal privacy policies, what responsibility lies with both the provider and the consumer regarding the retention time of private information?

answers.A: Both the provider and the consumer are responsible for setting the appropriate retention time
answers.B: Neither the provider nor the consumer has a responsibility for setting the appropriate retention time
answers.C: Only the consumer is responsible for setting an appropriate retention time
answers.D: Only the provider is responsible for ensuring the appropriate retention time

questions.question: What type of attack involves an attacker behaving as a store-and-forward or proxy mechanism between two communicating systems?
What is the fundamental purpose of logging and monitoring in an organization's security measures?

answers.A: To store backups of critical data
answers.B: To track, record, and review activity to detect and respond to security incidents
answers.C: To manage and enforce user access controls
answers.D: To create a record of all employee activities

questions.question: What is the benefit of structured walk-throughs in disaster recovery testing?

answers.A: Observe live actions in a controlled environment
answers.B: Conduct a full shut-down and restoration at the primary site
answers.C: Test operational response to disaster scenarios
answers.D: Interrupt real operations at the primary site

questions.question: Which security process metric would most assist in determining an appropriate backup frequency for a database server?
What constitutional amendment outlines the burden placed on investigators to have a valid search warrant before conducting certain searches?
Which tool is frequently used to directly access websites without a browser and is often utilized for testing and identifying potential API vulnerabilities?
What is the distinguishing characteristic of symmetric-key cryptography?

answers.A: It tends to be CPU intensive
answers.B: It uses the same key for encryption and decryption
answers.C: It provides integrity protection to data
answers.D: It uses different but related keys for encryption and decryption

questions.question: What is the result of 5521211 modulo 1337?
Which of the following is an example of a strong password?
Which model consists of the Application Layer, Host-to-Host Layer, Internet Layer, and Network Access Layer?
What is the primary purpose of 'inference engine' in the context of expert systems?

answers.A: To infer new facts and solve problems using rules and facts in the knowledge base
answers.B: To encrypt messages passed across the Internet
answers.C: To enable recognition of an entity by a system
answers.D: To control access to resources in a system

questions.question: What is the primary objective of conducting code reviews for bespoke and custom software applications within the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard guidelines?

answers.A: To expedite the deplxoyment of bespoke and custom software into production
answers.B: To exploit potential coding vulnerabilities in production software
answers.C: To ensure bespoke and custom software meets performance benchmarks under heavy load
answers.D: To ensure that bespoke and custom software cannot be exploited via coding vulnerabilities

questions.question: Which principle of cybersecurity focuses on ensuring that data is accurate and trustworthy?
An IDS installed on the network perimeter sees a spike in traffic during off-duty hours and begins logging and alerting. Which type of IDS is in place?
Which of the following is a desirable property of a biometric system?
